intro: Koanophyllon sinaloensis, commonly known as the Sinaloan leafy grass, is a perennial flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It is often found in dry slopes and open woodlands, where it thrives with minimal water. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
